original_title: Sri Lanka planning to scrap import controls on 300-400 items: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is making plans to remove import controls on 300 to 400 items next week, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya has said.
Strengthening of the rupee has allowed import controls to be removed, Minister Siyambalapitiya said in a statement.
Sri Lanka has about 1,200 items under import control, he said.
In 2021 and 2022 when Sri Lanka non-controlled imports like building materials and investment goods surged amid money printing, about 3,000 items were controlled.
The items that are allowed in will be useful as inputs to small and medium enterprises, he said. (Colombo/June02/2023)
